intro: Solanum uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flower nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale green. Its berries, which are toxic, are often mistaken for edible fruits due to their appearance. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
